A new survey by Politico found that in the states and congressional districts where the 2014 election will be won or lost , likely voters say they would prefer to vote for a Republican over a Democrat by seven percentage points , 41 percent to 34 percent .
About 25 percent of the respondents said they were unsure how they would vote .

Republicans are confident they will pick up at least the six seats necessary to regain control of the Senate in November , while counting on adding slightly to their majority in the House .
And for now , many  political analysts agree with that assessment .
The Democrats currently hold a 55 to 45 seat majority .
Meanwhile , Republicans are likely to pick up five to eight House seats net in November , according to the latest projection .
There is at least a glimmer of hope that the Democrats might somehow retain their majority .

Freshman Sen. Mark Pryor ( R - AR ) is locked in a tough reelection battle with Rep. Tom Cotton , a former Army captain and Harvard Law graduate and one of the strongest challengers recruited by the national GOP party .
He 's still only at 44 percent in the RealClearPolitics Average , but he is showing some signs of life that were n't really there a month ago , according to RCP .
Meanwhile , Democrat Michelle Nunn , the daughter of former Sen. Sam Nunn , is showing some strength in her bid to win a Republican Georgia Senate seat for her party in November .

A May 10 Atlanta Journal - Constitution poll shows Michelle  Nunn defeating Rep. Phil Gingrey ( R ) by 15 points , Rep. Paul Broun ( R ) by 13 points , Rep Jack Kingston ( R ) by 10 points and former Georgia Secretary of  State Karen Handel by eight  points .
